summary: Email correspondence between defense and prosecution attorneys regarding proposed redactions to motions in limine (MILs) in the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The email includes attachments of revised redaction proposals and requests for certain exhibits to be filed under seal.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Sending revised redaction proposals for motions in limine on behalf of the defense team.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Copied on email correspondence regarding redactions to motions in limine.

events.title: Redaction proposals submitted
events.description: Defense attorneys submit revised redaction proposals for motions in limine in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Prosecution request for redaction coordination
events.description: Prosecution emails defense attorneys to coordinate redaction proposals for motions in limine, requesting response by Thursday at 10 a.m.

locations: 1 Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Defense attorneys submitted revised redaction proposals for motions in limine in the Ghislaine Maxwell case on November 4, 2021.
The defense requested that several exhibits be filed under seal, including Exhibits A and B to Defense MIL #4, Exhibit 1 to Defense MIL #7, and Exhibit A to Defense MIL #13.
The correspondence shows ongoing legal proceedings and evidentiary disputes in the Maxwell case as of late 2021.
The email thread includes multiple attachments containing proposed redactions to various defense motions.
The prosecution had previously requested coordination on redaction proposals, indicating both sides were working to protect sensitive information before court filing.
